title: How to Make True Black Marshmallow Fondant

steps.headline: Put the marshmallows in a microwave safe bowl, add the water, and microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir mixture, and microwave for another minute.
Take the marshmallow mixture out of the microwave.
Stir again, scraping the sides with a scraper.
steps.description: Careful: the marshmallow mixture is hot!

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips, and stir until the chips are completely melted.
Add the corn syrup and stir again, this time with a butter knife, until all of the syrup is incorporated.

steps.description: of black gel food coloring, and stir again with the knife. Make sure to scrape around the edges.

steps.headline: Add about half of the bag of powdered sugar, once the mixture is the blackest black that you can get.
Stir with the knife until the mixture is thick.
Grease your hands liberally with butter or butter substitute and add the rest of the powdered sugar to the bowl.
Knead the fondant until all of the powdered sugar is gone.
